javadoc: ExternalConflictInfoPanel appears above the 4 listings in the ListingMergeWindow. It indicates the Externals phase. It also indicates how many groups of conflicts to resolve, how many individual conflict need resolving for that named external, and how far you are along in the process.

methods.javadoc: Creates a new ExternalConflictInfoPanel to use above the listings.
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Creates a new ExternalConflictInfoPanel to use above the listings.

methods.javadoc: Returns a string indicating the current phase of the External merge.
methods.name: getConflictType
methods.comment: Returns a string indicating the current phase of the External merge.

methods.javadoc: Returns the current external label or function's pathname being resolved as displayed by this panel.
methods.name: getLabelPathName
methods.comment: Returns the current external label or function's pathname being resolved as displayed by this panel.

methods.name: setConflictType
methods.comment: Call this to set the phase of the Listing merge that you are in currently.

params.name: conflictType
params.comment:
the type of conflict being resolved by this phase
 (for example, Symbols).

methods.name: setExternalName

name: ExternalConflictInfoPanel
comment:
ExternalConflictInfoPanel appears above the 4 listings in the ListingMergeWindow.
 It indicates the Externals phase.
 It also indicates how many groups of conflicts to resolve,
 how many individual conflict need resolving for that named external, 
 and how far you are along in the process.
